ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a reading based seminar where we critically analyze texts on the history of human-environment interactions in Africa in the context of local cultures and colonialism. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who is interested in human-enviornment interactions outside a Western context.

It is more than the environmental history of Africa. It is a class that uses the environmental both literally and metaphorically to deconstruct a history of a region that is often misrepresented in academia. Yes, I'd recommend it to anyone interested in a general history of the context. I'd recommend it to anyone going into international policy as it provides the tools to understanding global politics in the aftermath of imperialism.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
